Reviews.Title: “At most: average”
Reviews.Author: BoBoBabo
Reviews.Content: Can't expect the Taj Mahal at 79$ a night. The lady at the reception was very nice. Room clean, but it was noisy,(unless you like listening in on you neighbor) and just forget about the breakfast in the morning. It's Ok, if you want a realy cheap place to stay in Montreal, but don't expect much.

Reviews.Title: “Staff Needs Customer Service Training”
Reviews.Author: ERICA047
Reviews.Content: A former Montrealer, I recently traveled back to the city to celebrate Passover with family. Although I found our room to be recently renovated and essentially clean (aside from a few stains on the carpet), my experience booking the room was so off-putting that I will never return to this property. I called the hotel directly and was connected to a front-desk clerk named "Julia" who took my reservation. From the outset, Julia was abrasive. When giving her my address, I tried to tell her the city I lived in, after providing my street name and number. But she wouldn't take it, instead snapping at me that she only needed my "postal code", if she had that, my city information would automatically appear on her screen. (OK, but say it politely...) We had the same interaction about my AAA membership number. I asked if she needed the entire number, or my individual membership number only (which is all I usually need to give down here in the old US of A). Again she responded in an impatient, unpleasant tone. Finally we got to my credit card information. I read the number out to her, and as she heard each digit, she repeated it out loud. I asked her not to do this, as someone might be in within earshot, and it's not inconceivable that my number could be copied down and used illegally,. ( In my recent experience in Boston, merchants *never* repeat a card number aloud, as a protection against identity theft.) But Julia would have none of it..instead of responding to my request she told me that "no one was in the lobby" so it was all right for her to repeat my card numbers out loud! At that point I told her that I thought she should treat me with greater politeness and consideration, given that I would be spending close to $300 at the Quality Inn in the upcoming weekend. Her response was to tell me that "she was giving me to somebody else" and to leave me hanging on the telephone for five minutes! I subsequently called back and needed to rebook all over again, with another clerk. Upon reading a number of other reviews, I note that many other travelers had concerns about the customer service they received at this property. Although the general manager, Mr. Sammy Basaran, listened kindly to my concerns when I contacted him, I would hope he'd invest in customer relations and sensitivity training for his front desk people. Things are hard enough all around without having to be subjected to abuse..as a paying customer.. on a holiday weekend !

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 star, but good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: ThePianoManII
Reviews.Content: Pros: If you're looking for a kosher breakfast included with a kosher restaurant in the hotel, you won't find it anywhere, as far as I know, in all of North America except at Passover. Renovations include the front area--looking very nice. Beds: Comfortable! Staff: For the most part, very friendly and helpful. We needed 2 "pack 'n plays" for the kids to sleep in--they were brought up within minutes. We asked for more towels to be brought to the pool. Done. Rooms: Clean. Quiet too. Value: We stayed using points so the trip was free, but for just over $100 per night normally, and that kosher breakfast, it has been worth it when we've paid. Nearby: synagogues--2 within 2 blocks, including one with a minyan factory (if you're Jewish, you'll understand), and another kosher restaurant, this one not in, but beside the hotel with excellent fast-ish food (Pizza Pita). Subway (in french, metro) is a few minutes walk away and the subway system in Montreal is excellent. Bus stop nearby to take you there too. The Pool: warm, very kid-friendly (no deep end). Cons: Well, not so much, not if you know you're not getting a 5 star hotel here. 3rd floor hallway could smell better. Wifi did not work on the 3rd floor while we were there and they were not able to repair the problem during that period--if that matters, get a room on a lower level. They DO offer a wire to connect through ethernet connection in the room. Bathrooms: while clean and well functioning, could use a reno. Lack of variety in rooms: No suites available so if you are travelling with kids and don't want to spring for connecting rooms, you're looking at going to bed early at the same time as very young 'uns, hangin' in the hallway or cozying up to your own personal DVD player to watch movies on a small screen with your better half. Overall, I'd come back with no hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “We will definitely come back!”
Reviews.Author: Adil E
Reviews.Content: My wife, my daughter and I spent 11 nights at the Quality Midtown MontrÃ©al. The staff did a tremendous job answering all our requests. They cared about everything that helped us feel at home. Free parking! free, generous and varied breakfast! Large and renovated rooms! Nice pool and gym space! Wifi access! Very useful free business area, and a confortable lobby! Excellent and close enough from perfect!

Reviews.Title: “very good stay”
Reviews.Author: aniska
Reviews.Content: We went there during Thanksgiving long weekend. Did not make a reservation because we actually wanted to stay downtown Montreal but the huge traffic convinced us to stop there and consider getting to town by metro. It turned out to be a great idea because this hotel is brand new and very affordable in terms of price. The parking is included, as wi-fi and a good breakfast, too. The staff was friendly and corteous, the room was quiet (our room had soundproof-windows), big and clean; they even changed the bedsheets on our 2nd day's stay. We also saw a swimming pool and a little spa center (still on construction) which will make this hotel ever worthier. The metro station is 5 minutes walking away and with the orange line we got to Montreal in 15 minutes without worrying about very crowded and expensive parking lots... We visited the city, came back for a break and left again for dinner; our stay went on very smoothly and we were totally happy and satisfied of our choice.

Reviews.Title: “good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Habsrule29
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this at this hotel on business trip.Good location, close to the metro stop and highways. Met the owner who asked my opinion of his place. I told him it was ok and met my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “A great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Esmond C
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from Montreal having stayed 5 nights at Quality Hotel Midtown. I really cannot praise the hotel enough. The front desk staff were always extremely helpful. The room was spacious and spotless, with clean linen daily, clean towels daily. Tea and coffee in the room and a good refrigerator. The complimentary breakfasts were very satisfying. The lobby and lounge were spacious, clean and comfortable. There are two computers in the lobby for free internet use. A very well-equiped fitness room and small swimming pool. The car park is next to the main entrance of the hotel providing easy access.. There are hot drinks (tea/coffee) available in the lobby 24/7. There is a very good restaurant next to the hotel. There are 2 bus stops outside the hotel.and a subway station less than 5 minutes walk up the road. I would highly recommend this hotel and hope to have an opportunity to stay there again. (I can't comment on room service as I had no need of it).

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Affordability”
Reviews.Author: artgKanata_Ontario
Reviews.Content: This hotel provided a room in a very well-located part of Montreal. The room was clean, comfortable and well appointed, with a good-sized refrigerater with a working freezer. Staff were available and responsive to my needs. For those on a budget, looking for a great location in Montreal, this is a good choice. You can easily get to anywhere from this location, and super bonus, leave your car behind (highly recommended when visiting more central locations in Montreal). The breakfast was very good, included all of my essentials. Note that the parking lot is small and may fill up most evenings. Do ask at the desk for alternative parking, just in case.

Reviews.Title: “Don't. Just Don't.”
Reviews.Author: T W
Reviews.Content: So, I admit, I do give the benefit of the doubt, and having read mixed reviews about this place, we decided to go ahead and try it. If you are in that position now, please don't do it. I do have some basic standards. Functional bed. Clean towels. No old food on the floor. Five rooms later, this hotel barely met them, and only out of desperation. Please, for the price of a room here, you deserve so much better! (And don't book on a third party website (i.e. hotels.com), because getting a refund or financial compensation is a huge run around.) These were my experiences the ONE night (we originally booked for two) I stayed here. Usually, if the hall smells, and then the room smells the way this room smelled when we walked in the door, I walk right back out. But it was a busy weekend, the hour was late, and I was tired and new to Montreal. I found at first glance the place was maybe OK if we opened the windows and aired out the room, but just wait: 1.) The room smelled moldy. I later found out from the maintenance guy that this is because if the housekeepers "run out of time" turning over the rooms, they just leave them. Think wet towels piled up on the bathroom floor. 2.) The windows didn't open. A maintenance guy did come remove the winter-proofing (it was SEPTEMBER!) so that they could be opened. 3.) Because I am concerned about bed bugs, I automatically do the "luggage-in-the-bath-tub-bed-bug-check" and while no bugs turned up, layers of dust, a wad of hair, corn chips, a toothpick, fingernail/toenail clippings, one Canadian penny and one US penny, a torn/broken box spring cover, busted bed frame wheel (like, so the bed sank dangerously when I sat upon it. Photos to come.)â€¦and the TV remote did. (Also, the fitted sheet was inside out, minor, I know, but who does that?) The reviewer who mentioned the stains was on point--wallpaper stained and torn in many places, and the grout in the bathtub tiles was stained with mildew--also likely contributing to the moldy smell upon entry. (Bleach? It works.)The staff seemed nice enough, but had that "I know, but that's how it is here" look in their eyes. There is only so much they can do. And there is SO MUCH THAT NEEDS TO BE DONE. And their computer system was "not working." (I get the sense, in retrospect, it is never working.) As I mentioned before, room one, our bed broke/was broken. (No we were not even doing anything exciting.) And so, we went down and asked for another room. The woman apologized and gave us key cards for a new room that, you guessed it, had not been turned over in I don't know how long! Read: UNMADE BEDS, DIRTY TOWELS ON FLOOR OF BATHROOM, SMELLS LIKE MIDDLE SCHOOL BOYS' LOCKER ROOM! Room three, third time's a charm, right? Nope. Third room was unclean and had what, to my eye, could have been vomit stains on the wall behind bed (photos to come.) Room four, this time staff goes with us to pick out a room. Room four had missing outlet covers and a BED FRAME THAT DID NOT FIT THE BROKEN BOX SPRING WHICH WAS COVERED UP WITH A SHEET OF PLYWOOD!!!!!!! I started laughing, because if I didn't, I would cry. I cannot make this up. Photos to come. Room five, midnight, enough already, super dusty behind beds, but no fingernails or corn chips and I really was done with the place but was exhausted. Good thing the traffic noise from the highway outside my window was there to lull me to sleep. Also, the elevator stopped working during our stay. The free wi-fi was worse than dial-up, it crashed/weak signal/ just didn't work. And other guests were overheard complaining about having to find parking on the street, as the lot was full and does not have enough spaces for all the guests if they are full--which, by the way, they said they were, and yet they kept showing us empty but unclean room after unacceptable room. And, are you ready for the best part? At 4:10am we were awakened, after finally having fallen asleep on the really old mattress, by someone else opening the door to our room and banging the metal inside lock again and again and speaking very loudly and agitatedly in French. That's right. THEY DEACTIVATED OUR KEY CARDS AND CHECKED SOMEONE ELSE INTO OUR ROOM AFTER HAVING PICKED OUT THE ROOM WITH US! When I called the front desk and asked in a tone of contained rage, "Who please has keys to my room and is trying to enter at 4:10am?" it was 4 or 5 sentences into the excuse making before the guy even apologized. Don't stay here. Just don't. Three point 5 stars, they are certainly not. What they are is DIRTY, disorganized and outrageously cheap without being inexpensive. I'm sure some manager will respond with damage control comments instead of actually taking care of the problems at their establishment. Just ignore. And save yourself the headache/nightmare that we had, so that you could be forewarned.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great visit , Thank you”
Reviews.Author: Michael B
Reviews.Content: Breakfast was great, and the service was great, the assistance at the fron table was vey helpful with directions of how to get places in Montreal. Ovearall we had a very pleasant experience at the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hidden surprise”
Reviews.Author: Madhu N
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. It has a very good complimentary breakfast. An extremely welcoming staff all day long. They will try to accomidate you ifyou are disatisfied. The pool even though it was 30" deep was safe for my five year old. This is a great family hotel located in a great neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Gail D
Reviews.Content: Very accommodating, friendly, clean, family environment.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: DuffelBag
Reviews.Content: Beds were saggy. Continental breakfast is better than most. The restaurant next door, Pizza Pita, was terrific. It was the area's best, open late, and had kosher options.

Reviews.Title: “Visting Montreal for the Grand Prix”
Reviews.Author: tabarlo
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself and my brother-in-law stayed here while visiting Montreal for the Grand Prix. The price was great. The location is not super close to a lot of the events going on, but it was very close to the subway, so we were able to get where we needed to go without getting a taxi. Also the subway system is very easy to navigate, we had no problems at all. The staff was very kind, they even had refreshments on the day we arrived for the Grand Prix weekend. The staff was also very helpful, with directions and suggestions. The rooms were in good condition. Clean and comfortable. Breakfast was good, it is what you would except for continental breakfast. I would absolutely stay here again. Maybe again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: grandpajoe
Reviews.Content: We loved the atmosphere, the location, the free breakfast - the helpful staff

Reviews.Title: “I am very impressed”
Reviews.Author: butterfly17981948
Reviews.Content: I have travelled exensively and I am a resident of Montreal. I stayed at the Quality Hotel Midtown on Decarie Blvd. in Montreal, for several months due to repairs in my home. I was looking for a well located, family oriented hotel with easy accessible parking., breakfast included with variety. This was an excellent choice on my part. The Manager Mr. Sammy made me feel at ease and at home and the hotel was run like a perfect clock. He was always available, and went out of his way for guests.. His front desk staff was very professional and hand picked. The Sales Manager Ms. Alyssia was very accomodating to the tour groups, families and individuals and was seen throughout the day always observing.. Cleaning staff on the premises were very proud of their work. I was there when renovations took place and it was kept very clean. Beautiful decor, happy colors and a very comfortable to meet and chat in the lobby. Ms. VIctoria in charge of housekeeping made sure each room was impeccable and her staff always had a smile and if there was a request made it was filled immediately.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: kookookajoob
Reviews.Content: This isn't a 5* Hotel, but it's reasonable for the price you pay. The breakfast is included in the price, which does NOT contain "different unknown dishes" as one reviewer suggests...lol (that silly review still makes me roll my eyes) We stayed 3 nights and helped ourselves to a freebie breakfast every morning... why not? The rooms aren't the greatest in the world, but they are comfortable and clean. The location is fabulous for getting around Montreal. I don't have a laptop computer, but I was able to help myself to the two desktops available for guests in the lobby, no problems. I guess the bottom line is, if you're a fussy traveler, don't stay at this Hotel, if it's affordability you seek, this Hotel fits the bill perfectly!

Reviews.Title: “I think I liked it...i give it 3.5/5”
Reviews.Author: moments2remember
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was nice. The staff looked disorganized, our reservation, we did it online but the staff was just adding to her own calculation and wasn't looking at the actual reservation price given, she was about to charge us extra, good thing we asked over and over, or else we would have been charged an extra $100. And I don't know if she was stressed or what, but she didn't punch in the code for our room properly, and so when we went upstairs, none of our keys were working! But we forgave her, because she gave us a really nice and comfortable room. We did receive continental breakfasts for the two days we stayed, unfortunately didn't get the chance to experience it. The breakfast from 7:00am to 10:00am (reasonable times, but we were just to lazy to get out of bed early.) There is free parking available, but make sure to be home by 10pm or you won't find a parking in the hotel, you would have to park by the houses, (which was a hassle because everything is one way, so it took us forever to find one!!). The staff at the front desk suggested a parking spot, which was covered by fences. It was creepy and no cars were there, so we decided to drive around till we found one by the houses. They also have internet access. Internet was annoying to use. The connections wouldn't connect properly. They also had a small fridge in our room, which was nice. Anyways... If you plan on driving, this hotel is a great location. Everything is close by. The first day wasn't smooth but the second day we were enjoying ourselves. Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “Complimentary Breakfast...”
Reviews.Author: Ruguna
Reviews.Content: Our recent trip to Montreal ended up so stressful thanks to the great service provided by this hotel. We had searched for a hotel with moderate rate, which also would include the breakfast, thinking this would ease us the problem of finding a proper breakfast for the kids in the morning. According to the conditions to which we booked the hotel, a continental breakfast was included in the rate. The first morning when we went for breakfast, we found ourselves in front of a buffet of different unknown dishes and some frozen canned fruits. Thats the continental breakfast provided. Upon enquiring at the reception about it, we were told that its a complimentary service, so we may eat it or leave it. Much later it turned out that the hotel is a jewish hotel, providing the jewish guest a special diet over the easter holidays. I totally respect other cultures and religions. But it was unfair towards the others like us, who dont follow those principles. Moreover the rooms where also sort of filthy for a three star hotel, with dirty carpets on the floor and stained curtains in the bath. I'm sure there are much better hotels around the same area for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Congrats Quality Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: relaxingenergie
Reviews.Content: Well, they are on their way. I can't believe all the updates and renovations that they did. It is cleaner, the service is better and the beds are just awesome. They still need to work on some glitches but they are going the right direction. Our room door wasn't working and they changed our room within minutes. The breakfast is better than it was. The fact that it is kosher serves the purpose for all kinds of guests. We had an issue with one of the cleaning crew and we came to the front desk and the next day.. done.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for road travellers”
Reviews.Author: halifaxcalling
Reviews.Content: The Good: -Great rates. -Free parking, which saves $7 to $20 a night. -Perfect location: 5 min. max walk to the Metro through a cool neighbourhood, 15min metro ride downtown. -Excellent showers. -Clean rooms, great maid service. -Breakfast is continental, but has some eggs and other good additions. Also open till 10am. The bad: -Internet is abysmal. -Pool was closed when we were there, which was bad because that's why we chose this over another hotel. Pool is also pretty small, if it were useable. Nice work out room, though. Reccomendation: Good stay, esp. if you're driving in.

Reviews.Title: “good service, workers and location”
Reviews.Author: zehavahaber
Reviews.Content: every body was very pilite, helpful, kind and very nice to us

HotelInfo.Name: Quality Hotel Midtown
HotelInfo.Address: 6445 Boul Decarie, Montreal, Quebec H3W 3E1, Canada
